title: How to Fix an iPhone That Won't Make Calls but Can Text

steps.title: Contact your carrier.
steps.content: Contact your carrier. Make sure your account doesn't have any billing issues, as this can result in your service being suspended. Additionally, check for any service outages in your area, and that your iPhone is set up properly with your account. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Update your iPhone
steps.content: Update your iPhone . Keep your phone software up-to-date. Software updates include important bug fixes and, most times, stronger security features. Do the following: Go to Settings . Tap General . Tap Software Update . Tap Download and Install .

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle on "Airplane Mode".
steps.content: Toggle on "Airplane Mode". The switch will turn green.

steps.title: Toggle off "Airplane Mode".
steps.content: Toggle off "Airplane Mode". The switch will turn grey.

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center . Swipe down on the top-right corner to open it. If your iPhone has a Home button, swipe up from the bottom of the screen to open it. You can use Do Not Disturb to temporarily silence text and calls.

steps.title: Tap Do Not Disturb.
steps.content: Tap Do Not Disturb . This looks like a crescent moon icon. If this feature is enabled, it will turn off.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. If you have any contacts blocked, you won't be able to receive any calls.

steps.title: Tap Phone.
steps.content: Tap Phone . You can find this below Voice Memos .

steps.title: Tap Blocked Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Blocked Contacts . This will be underneath Silence Unknown Callers .

steps.title: Unblock
steps.content: Unblock the contact. If the contact was unintentionally blocked, you can unblock them here. You should now be able to receive calls from them.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. If you have any contacts blocked, you won't be able to receive any calls.

steps.title: Tap Phone.
steps.content: Tap Phone . You can find this below Voice Memos .

steps.title: Tap Call Forwarding.
steps.content: Tap Call Forwarding . This will be below Respond with Text .

steps.title: Toggle off "Call Forwarding".
steps.content: Toggle off "Call Forwarding". If this is enabled, this will send your calls to another number.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. If you have any contacts blocked, you won't be able to receive any calls.

steps.title: Tap Phone.
steps.content: Tap Phone . You can find this below Voice Memos .

steps.title: Tap Silence Unknown Callers.
steps.content: Tap Silence Unknown Callers . This will be underneath Show My Caller ID .

steps.title: Toggle off "Silence Unknown Callers".
steps.content: Toggle off "Silence Unknown Callers". If you were missing calls from numbers that are not on your contact list, you should now receive them properly.

steps.title: Try making or receiving calls in a different location.
steps.content: Try making or receiving calls in a different location. It could be that you have no coverage in that particular area. If the area is causing trouble, try to improve your reception .

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . You can find this below Screen Time .

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Transfer or Reset iPhone.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Transfer or Reset iPhone . This is at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Reset.
steps.content: Tap Reset . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Reset Network Settings.
steps.content: Tap Reset Network Settings . This will erase all current settings for Wi-Fi, preferred networks, and VPN settings.

steps.title: Contact Apple Support
steps.content: Contact Apple Support . If your iPhone is still experiencing issues, the problem could be a faulty device. Contact Apple support for repairs or options for your specific warranty.
